heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: Currently no stormy weather.  The most recent storm happened on 21 September 2025 and it lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (187°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (233.0°) by approximately 46.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 2.2°C) and outside temperature (up 2.2°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 5%).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 4922 lux) and cloud levels (up 874 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 373.5m lower than yesterday, 873.6m lower than the past week, 534.4m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 929m to 2240m and averaged 1171.6m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, humidity should not be a concern and little or no wind. Chance of light rain, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and some sunny spells will occur. The weather will likely remain the same.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
